column1: The Pit Room////The Pit Room looks like an authentic Texas bbq spot
column2: but seems to be average at best. If you go to Texas
column3: you need to get bbq. I would keep this place as a 'plan b' if your 'plan a' fails for whatever reason. Usually a line so expect to wait a while. The beef ribs are good
column4: just a little too fatty for my preference and the brisket is okay at best. The elote comes in a cup
column5: not off the cob as I thought it would. The best thing I ordered was the side of mac and cheese. At first glance
column6: I thought it was going to be overcooked
column7: but it turned out to be pretty good. Overall
column8: I'd say the food is about average
column9: didn't necessarily meet or exceed my expectations of "authentic Texas bbq" but wouldn't completely steer someone away from it.
